meanings.definition: A straight line that a curve approaches but never meets.
meanings.sent1: The graph of the function had two asymptotes that it got closer to but never touched.
meanings.sent2: In math class, we learned about how curves can have asymptotes that they get closer to but never actually intersect.
meanings.sent3: The asymptotes and the curve were like two friends who always walked side by side but never held hands.
meanings.sent4: The idea of asymptotes is like chasing a rainbow - you can get closer and closer, but you'll never reach the end.
meanings.sent5: Asymptotes are like the horizon - no matter how far you go, you can never quite reach them.

meanings.definition: A curve that continually approaches a given line but does not meet it at any finite distance.
meanings.sent1: The graph showed how the curve had asymptotes that it got closer to but never crossed.
meanings.sent2: The concept of asymptotes helps us understand how curves can get infinitely close to a line without touching it.
meanings.sent3: The curve and the asymptotes played a game of tag, but they could never quite catch each other.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the curve and the asymptotes is like a dance where they move closer and closer but never make contact.
meanings.sent5: Asymptotes are like magnets - the curve is drawn towards them, but they repel each other at the last moment.
